maml:description.maml:para: Authenticates to the Pax8 REST API.
The Pax8 API uses OAuth 2.0 and requires a `client_id` and `client_Secret` to authenticate.
Create your developer application first and then use those credentials here.
Specifies a `client_Id` for the credential. The parameter name, `-credential`, is optional.
When you submit the command and specify a `client_Id`, you're prompted for a `client_secret`. If you omit this parameter, you're prompted for a `client_Id` and a `client_secret`.
Specifies a `client_Id` for the credential. The parameter name, `-credential`, is optional.
When you submit the command and specify a `client_Id`, you're prompted for a `client_secret`. If you omit this parameter, you're prompted for a `client_Id` and a `client_secret`.
Disconnects the current session.
Disconnects the current session.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes the token variable from the script session.

Returns only companies matching this `selfServiceAllowed` value.

This parameter also creates a dynamic parameter `-direction` when used.
This allows you to sort the results by an ascending or descending direction.

- `asc`
- `desc`

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new company.
The company will be placed in an inactive status until the company has primary contacts added.
The company name.
The company address.
The primary phone number of the company.
The full URL of the company website.
An external Id that can be assigned to the company for reference.
Value is true if Pax8 handles billing transactions.
Value is false if partner handles billing transactions.
Value is true if self-service privileges are available to the company, otherwise value is false.
Value is true if the company's self-service orders require approval, otherwise value is false.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The company address.
Value is true if Pax8 handles billing transactions.
Value is false if partner handles billing transactions.
An external Id that can be assigned to the company for reference.
The company name.
Value is true if the company's self-service orders require approval, otherwise value is false.
The primary phone number of the company.
Value is true if self-service privileges are available to the company, otherwise value is false.
The full URL of the company website.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$newParams = @{ name = 'Initech' address = @{ street = '4120 Freidrich Ln' city = 'Austin' postalCode = 78744 stateOrProvince = 'Texas' country = 'US' } phone = '999-999-9999' website = 'initech.lumbergh.co' billOnBehalfOfEnabled = $false selfServiceAllowed = $false orderApprovedRequired = $false }
New-Pax8Company @newParams

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a new company.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new contact for a company.
Creates a new contact for a company.
The company Id.
The first name.
The last name.
The email.
The phone number.
The contact type (array of objects).
Valid values for `type`:
- `Admin`
- `Billing`
- `Technical`
Valid values for `primary`:
- `$true`
- `$false`
Valid syntax: `@( @{ type = 'Admin'; primary = $true } )`
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The company Id.
The email.
The first name.
The last name.
The phone number.
The contact type (array of objects).
Valid values for `type`:
- `Admin`
- `Billing`
- `Technical`
Valid values for `primary`:
- `$true`
- `$false`
Valid syntax: `@( @{ type = 'Admin'; primary = $true } )`

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$newParams = @{ companyId = 'c0486b84-3bfd-4f14-964a-1b5699b824ce' firstName = 'Bill' lastName = 'Lumbergh' email = 'blumbergh@initech.lumbergh.co' phone = '666-666-6666' types = @( @{ type = 'Admin'; primary = $true } ) }
